facts.text: An election was held for one seat to the U.P. Legislative Council from the Rohilkhand Graduates Constituency on April 22, 1962.
There were 14 candidates, election held by proportional representation by means of single transferable vote. Total votes cast: 4412, 2207 first preference votes required.
No candidate secured minimum at first count, subsequent counts excluding lowest. Satya Ketu got highest after last count, declared elected by margin of 47 votes.

Appellant filed election petition claiming election of Satya Ketu void due to invalid votes counted in his favour: ballot papers marked with Roman numeral I instead of Arabic 1, invalid under r.73(2) of Conduct of Elections Rules, 1961.
Satya Ketu contended all votes counted in his favour were valid.

Election Tribunal scrutinised ballot papers, held Roman numeral I invalid under r.73(2), 491 votes for Satya Ketu invalid, allowed petition, declared Satya Ketu's election void, appellant duly elected.
Judgment and decree dated March 10, 1965 of Allahabad High Court in F.A. No. 213 of 1964.
Satya Ketu appealed to High Court without copy of decree. Appellant raised preliminary objection on maintainability.

High Court overruled preliminary objection, held no copy of decree necessary under s.98 and s.116A of Representation of the People Act, 1951. On merits, held 460 of 491 votes valid (Roman I valid), Satya Ketu wins by 16 votes, allowed appeal, dismissed petition.
Tribunal directed preparation of decree containing details of costs, but no such decree prepared.
Appeal to Supreme Court on certificate by High Court.

legal_issues.text: Whether appeal to High Court maintainable without copy of decree from Tribunal under s.116A of Representation of the People Act, 1951.
Whether ballot papers marked with Roman numeral I instead of Arabic numeral 1 are invalid under r.73(2) of Conduct of Elections Rules, 1961.

petitioner_arguments.text: Appeal to High Court not maintainable as not accompanied by copy of decree.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: s.116A Representation of the People Act, 1951; Code of Civil Procedure O.XLI r.1; Allahabad High Court Rules Ch.IX r.8

petitioner_arguments.text: Tribunal correct: ballot papers with Roman numeral I invalid under r.73(2) as not bearing Arabic figure 1.

respondent_arguments.text: All votes counted valid, including those with Roman numeral I; petition should be dismissed.

court_reasoning.text: No provision in Representation of the People Act for tribunal to pass decree; s.98 requires order only. s.90(1) applies CPC procedure 'as nearly as may be' subject to Act. No decree required; appeal under s.116A from order, not decree. High Court rules Ch.XIV-A require copy of order only.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Preparation of decree unnecessary; memorandum of costs executable under s.122.

court_reasoning.text: r.73(2)(a) requires figure 1 marked for first preference, not specifically Arabic numeral. Roman I indicates figure 1, valid. Explanation added later confirms; additional words like 'st' or 'one' ignorable if figure 1 present.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Figure 1 in any form (Arabic, Roman, Indian language) suffices if clear.

holdings.text: No decree required after election petition trial; appeal under s.116A maintainable with copy of judgment/order only.
Ballot papers marked with Roman numeral I valid under r.73(2)(a) as they bear figure 1.

statutes_cited.name: Representation of the People Act, 1951
statutes_cited.relevance: Governs election petitions, trial procedure, orders, appeals, costs execution. No decree contemplated.

statutes_cited.name: Conduct of Elections Rules, 1961
statutes_cited.relevance: Defines invalid ballot papers; figure 1 may be in Roman or other forms.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Civil Procedure, 1908
statutes_cited.relevance: Applied 'as nearly as may be' to election trials; does not require decree.

outcome.summary: Supreme Court dismissed the appeal, upheld High Court: preliminary objection fails, Roman I votes valid, Satya Ketu duly elected.

key_quotes.text: "A ballot paper shall be invalid on which- (a) the figure 1 is not marked" - r.73(2)(a) does not specify Arabic form.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Central to interpreting validity of Roman I.

key_quotes.text: "So long as it is clear that figure 1 is marked on the ballot paper, the ballot paper would be valid."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "there is no provision therein for passing a decree by the election tribunal."
key_quotes.speaker: court
